solution:
Let $x = \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right).$  Then by repeated application of the double angle formula,
\begin{align*}
x \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) &= \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{2} \sin \left( \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \sin \left (\frac {8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{8} \sin \left( \frac{16 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \sin \left( \frac{32 \pi}{15} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \sin \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right),
\end{align*}so $x = \boxed{\frac{1}{16}}.$

Step 1: Use the product-to-sum identity $\cos A \cos B = \frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos (A + B) + \cos (A - B) \right]$ to pair the first two factors and simplify the expression.
\[\cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) = \frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} + \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} - \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right)\]
Step 2:
\[= \frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( - \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) = \frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right)\]
= \frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \left[ \frac{1}{2} \left( \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} + \frac{16 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} - \frac{16 \pi}{15} \right) \right) \right]
\[= \frac{1}{4} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \left[ \cos \left( \frac{24 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( - \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \right] = \frac{1}{4} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \left[ \cos \left( \frac{24 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \]
= \frac{1}{4} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \left[ \cos \left( \frac{24 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \right] = \frac{1}{4} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \left[ \cos \left( \frac{24 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \right] = \frac{1}{4} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \left[ 2 \cos \left( \frac{16 \pi}{15} \right

full_steps:
Step 1: Use the product-to-sum identity $\cos A \cos B = \frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos (A + B) + \cos (A - B) \right]$ to pair the first two factors and simplify the expression.
\[\cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left (\frac {4 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right) = \frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} + \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} - \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) \cos \left( \frac {16 \pi}{15} \right)\]

Use the product-to-sum identity $\cos A \cos B = \frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos (A + B) + \cos (A - B) \right]$ to pair the first two factors in the expression $\frac{1}{2} \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} \right) \left( 2 \cos \left( \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) - 1 \right) + \frac{1}{2} \cos \left( \frac{6 \pi}{15} \right) \left( 2 \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) - 1 \right).$
\[\frac{1}{2} \left[ \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} + \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{15} - \frac{4 \pi}{15} \right) \right] \left( 2 \cos \left( \frac{8 \pi}{15} \right) - 1
